number of helpful: 411 of 436 people (94%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												This looks like a game that is still in development.  The manual, and some of the text within the game is in French while the rest of the text, and the audio is in English.  The AI assistant you're given is incredibly annoying because the speed, and intonation of her speech is random, and wild.  She sounds like a lunatic!  The game has a learning curve, for sure, but good luck with that unless you speak French.  If you've played resource management games before (like SimCity), you may have an easier time picking this up, but that doesn't mean you'll want to play.  I actually own the very latest SimCity, and that gaming experience is a smooth pleasure compared to this game.  It stutters, and lags with every click.  When it does work, it's a dull mess.  It's an eyesore of a game, too.  Like an old DOS game.  Embarrassing.  It's not worth $1 because it's useless without a lot of other players involved, and no one is going to want to join you in this nightmare.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Right from the start, I am greeted with technical issues and constant lag. Opening any type of menu causes a long loading screen and unresponsive window. The design is very very poor, it runs in a window that frequently won't respond and it looks straight out of dialup. There also appears to be no way to change the size of the window. The settings menu... what settings menu? There's an option to turn off the annoying tutorial bot that constantly bothers you, but that's about it. There is absolutely zero sound in the entire game, I think that speaks for itself. The gameplay is completely esoteric, tedious, and for me boring. You can't progress much into the game without buying credits and premium, which is gonna cost you more than the game itself! The community of this game is consistent of either trolls, or people who invest their soul and heart into this game, there is no room for fun. I only got to play as a politician without paying 10 dollars for another character (nope), but from my experience there is nothing to do as a politican without any power, which makes the start of the game working to try to have fun eventually. Journalist and artist seem like more fun and open characters from what I have seen, except all you're going to be doing is designing articles in hopes that people will like them. One of the few positive things I can find about the game is the reason why I bought it, it's a very unique idea that could have been done well if the developers weren't in over their heads. Final Evaluation-----------------Pros: Unique idea, Many mediums to interact with the community, Low price ( 99 cents as of this review ), Room for creativity, Realtime simulationCons: Lag, poor design, bad community, no sound, tedious, microtransactions, frankly boringScore - 2/10

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												Oh dear lord, thank you, thank you so much. Ladies and gentlemen, we have been graced with the worst MMO of all time. I was lucky enough to pay a mere dollar for this game, yet they have the audacity to charge 5 times as much for this. How bad this game is can not be summed up in words. It doesn't work. I have a decent internet connection, and every time I click on something the game freezes for 5 seconds to load the next bit of text. Every. Single. Button. Your secretary? Speaks with one of those fake♥♥♥♥♥robot voices. And she does a horrible job of telling you what to do. I set up a profile and then BOOM I'm forced to make a schedule that my character will follow for the day. In real time. It's like farmville except you don't need to be there to play it, so what's the ♥♥♥♥ing point? I don't even think there's a goal, I just clicked on places and events until my schedule was filled up. And that was it. Nothing to play, I don't even know what to do anymore. I spent a dollar on this. That's a dollar that could have gone to cancer research. I just stopped the cure for cancer from happening by playing this game. Oh well, I got a good laugh out of it. If you want an MMO to play with your friends and have fun, please, god please, look elsewhere.

number of helpful: 8 of 20 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												World of Leaders is somewhat interesting for what it is, which is basically a browser-based mostly-text role-playing simulation game. The goal of the game is to reach the top of one-of-three professions, either politician, journalist, or musician/singer.  World of Leaders plays very similarly to this developer's other game called The Race For The White House, so if you have played that game then you know what to expect. I'm hoping they will continue to update and improve this game in the near future, because it seems unpolished and full of translation issues. I enjoyed their previoyus titles, so I am hopefull and enthusiastic about this one, but so far in reality there are better games out there covering the exact same topics/themes/professions with much more depth. Specifically I'm talking about a game called  Popmundo [www.popmundo.com\], which I played for 8 real years, becoming Mayor of Toronto, an infamous rapper. fathering 11 children, and leaving a trail of scandals in my wake. ...Almost like a real life Toronto Mayor!   This game is nowhere near as polished or deep as  Popmundo [www.popmundo.com\] yet, but this review was not meant to be an advertisement for Popmundo, so I'll just stick to talking about WoL. Pros: +Plays Like Race for the White House. If you enjoyed that game, you may enjoy this game. +You can create and control up to 3 characters. (one from each of the three professions) +Role-Playing encouraged with the ability to upload and create original essays, videos and/or etc +Extensive world map. An excessive amount of cities which you can base yourself out of.Meh: ~Currently has a small player base, but it is slowly growing. ~Small player base means very little social interaction. ~Small player base means you can begin the game as a city's mayor if the position is vacant. ~Hopefully the game will be updated and improved upon in the coming weeks and months. ~The game plays out in real time. There can be very little to do at times.Cons: -Overpriced. Similar games can be played free of charge. -Micro-transactions. Extra playable characters cost $7 each. Pay real money for game money. -Seems like the text was poorly translated using an online translation website or similar. -Some in game text appears in french. -Interface can be slow to load various screens, and rarely the game can freeze altogether. -The gameplay may appeal to the casual facebook crowd, but are Steam gamers too jaded & blasé?I'm not sure that I feel good about recommending this game, but I would not want to NOT recommend it and add yet another bad review to the already massive amount that it's already received. It's rough around the edges, but it is not such a bad game. I enjoyed Race for the White House and I am enjoying this game as well for the time being. It does not take long to play each day, or require all that much attention to succeed over time, but the game allows you to participate as much or as little as you want in terms of developing your character through creative writing or uploading other media. Don't expect to jump in right away and be a Boss. This is the type of game you play little by little over a long period of time. I guess I recomend this game, but only if you understand exactly what type of game it is beforehand, and only if you enjoy playing these type of games.

number of helpful: 14 of 76 people (18%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												Despite the other reviews I went ahead and got it. I figured what the heck $1. I've played other games like this and if you have to and enjoyed them you may like this one. Yes, it is what I would consider BETA status. However is fun, interactive, and unique. I have not found many bugs. More so just a few times having to go back to something I just did. Save work properly in case dc. Game has hiccups in connection, few, but noticable when writing and stuff. I had 1 DC the entire time I played for 6 hrs. Game just needs more players in it or AI players. The manual...guy" who posted...yes IN game the producers are French it seems or European. Go to the games store page and at right, player manual!...it is Steam and should open in your language; mine being English. Game was rather easy to pick up once you figure out stuff it gets really easy. 1 hr or even 3 of f'ing around and the next time you play you should be able to do you entire next game session in 5-30 minutes and part of that is if you plan ahead and what character you choose etc. Politician being hardest. Currently the game has almost zil for players "contesting" positions of power so get in while you can, seriously $1, garauntee you if you've played this type of game or like politics you will enjoy the $1 it is on sale for right now. For $5 though I would say while in beta, not worth it for $5 but it will be once enough people start playing. You can set stuff in advance to so you can probably afk for a month and your character should still do stuff if you use scheduler. Granted you may want to be on daily for popularity points and so your popularity doesn't drop because no login. It doesn't look like it drops much either.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												The overall thought on this game, which is more of a social experiment, is that is a failed rat trap of a team with a low budget. Words cannot come to my head to describe the intentions of the producers. What this game is absolutely null, if it can be said that this is even a game. This text-based governmental conspiracy-control loony bin has overwrought my nerves with cognitive errors and fullstops. People who linger on this worthless five dollar atrosity somehow find enjoyment and basic ability to provide bland and wortheless "articles" on political events that have never happened. Throughout observing this shoddily put-together epileptic monstrosity, I found myself befuddled by even the meer underlying concepts of this clipart-esque microsoft era visual horror. In all honesty, I fail to even maturely comprehend what this game is. What is it? Why does this exist? Who sat at an executive board for these geographic political simulation companies and perked his head up and said, "Let's make a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ forum board like "GAME", with confusing HUDs and GUIs that will probably give most of its players catastrophic anuerysms," then he stroked his bear manaically. The rest of the team did not hesitate to agree, and so the bandwagon rode off into the blissful horizon of World of Leaders. Through the course of twenty minutes then, they pumped out this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ What the hell is this. What the hell. WHAT THE HELL.

Posted: November 22, 2015
												The worst game I have ever played.Do not buy, reasons listed in all the other reviews (which I honestly wish I had read when I bought this game)22/04-2016 update: The devs seem to be finished with the game at this point. I don't remember seeing an update in the queue but there may have been a few. Still can't recommend it - the few updates can't possibly have made it much better. Please do not buy this game unless you feel like wasting 4.99€. You won't play it for long.

Posted: October 12, 2016
												It's the sort of game I like, as it is very comprehensive and explores so many real life factors in politics and public life. However, it is also slow (1 day in the game = 1 day in real life) and very, very laggy (though they might fix that). I'm not sure if this game will catch on with others.

												This game is all talk with no substance.It sounds great, and when you read about it-- it's exciting to me.All the concepts of the game are either unimportant because nobody plays or broken.There is an ear piercing tutorial robot b!tch who continually spouts annoying unmuteable voiceovers describing such broken concepts of the game.It's a cheap game, but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, it is not well put together at all.
